member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.GanttBaseOptions.TimeScaleHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of TimeScaleHeaderDefinition definitions.
member.remarks:
This list specifies the headers that are to be used in the chart view. The BaseTimeScaleUnitWidth defines the horizontal space taken by each header.
Ensure that the different time scale headers are added in appropriate order. For example, "days" should be added after "weeks" and not the other way.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.GanttBaseOptions.UseChartVirtualization
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to use virtualization while rendering the chart. If Virtualization is on, only the visible rows are rendered in the chart allowing you to load a very large number of rows. However, scrolling could be slower than when virtualization is false. Default is false for backward compatibility. Turn this to true, if the gantt takes longer than 2 seconds to load your data, to improve load time. Set this before the gantt loads. For performance reasons, resetting after the load is not supported.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.GanttBaseOptions.TaskBarBrowseToCueLeftTemplate
member.summary: The template that will be used to render the left arrow button in the browse-to task cue displayed to the left of a row, when the task is outside and to the left of the view. This cue will automatically display when a template is provided.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.GanttBaseOptions.TaskBarBrowseToCueRightTemplate
member.summary: The template that will be used to render the right arrow button in the browse-to task cue displayed to the right of a row, when the task is outside and to the right of the view. This cue will automatically display when a template is provided.

member.summary: A java script fuction that's called when the flat list representing each row in the table is created.

member.summary: Specifies the binding that returns a end time (DateTime) from the bound object representing a summary task.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.TaskItemTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the look and feel of a task rendered within each row. The root element in the template will be streched horizontally and vertically to the right size based on the task's start and end time.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.ParentTaskItemTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the look and feel of a summary-task rendered in the gantt chart. The root element in the template will be streched horizontally and vertically to the right size based on the task's start and end time. This template should be capable of rendering the different bound object types representing each summary row at different levels in the tree.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.TaskEndTimeProperty
member.summary: Specifies the binding that returns a end time (DateTime) from the bound object representing a task.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.ParentTaskEndTimeProperty
member.summary: Specifies the binding that returns a end time (DateTime) from the bound object representing a summary task.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.OverlappedTasksRenderingOptimization
member.summary: Specifies if the Task Bars can overlap or shrink to adjust the heights within the gantt chart rows.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.TasksListProperty
member.summary: If the leaf nodes in the tree contain a list of tasks that are meant to be displayed in the same row in the gantt chart, define this binding to return the list of tasks from the bound object (which will be the DataContext for this binding) representing the leaf-node. If your leaf node is itself a task, this should be null.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.ParentTasksListProperty
member.summary: If the parent nodes in the tree contain a list of tasks that are meant to be displayed in the same row in the gantt chart, define this binding to return the list of tasks from the bound object (which will be the DataContext for this binding) representing the parent-node. If your parent node itself represents a single task with properties representing the start and end times, then leave this at null and set the ParentTaskStartTimeBinding and ParentTaskEndTimeBinding properties.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.RowHeightBinding
member.summary: Use this to specify a varyting row height for each row in the FlexyGantt's FlexyTable. The source for this binding will be a FlexyNodeData instance which has a Data property which is a reference to the bound object corresponding to that row.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.HierarchyResolverFunction
member.summary: If there is a hierarchy that needs to be displayed in the grid on the left, then provide a "resolver function" here that will help retrieve a child list from a parent item.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.DynamicResolverFunction
member.summary: DynamicResolverFunction is same as hierarchy resolver function but it will call when the the flexyNodeData's ExpandState changed dynamically, and the value returned by resolverFunction will be ignored.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.UseTimeRangeFilteredTasksInRows
member.summary: Normally all the tasks within a row are rendered in the UI even if they are out the current view. But, this would bog things down if there are thounds of tasks to show in the view. Set this to true if you want them to be filtered every time the chart's view span changes. Use this in conjunction with UseTimeRangeFilteredTasksInRows, TimeRangeFilteredTasksTimeBuffer and FilterTasksByTimeRange event.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.TimeRangeFilteredTasksTimeBuffer
member.summary: The buffer to apply before and after the chart's view span when filtering tasks to show within that span, when UseTimeRangeFilteredTasksInRows is set to true

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.FlexyGanttOptions.FilterTasksByTimeRange
member.summary: Listener used to determine which set of tasks fall under the current chart view span.

member.summary: Options for the project gantt widget.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ProjectStartDate
member.summary: Specifies the project start date. This date will be used when StartTime is not available for a task.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ProjectEndDate
member.summary: Specifies the project start date. This date will be used when StartTime is not available for a task.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.FlatActivitiesListCreated
member.summary: The java script function that's called when the flat list of activities are created.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ValidateDependencySetting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether newly added dependencies should be validated for appropriateness. For example, a task cannot have a dependency on it's parent/summary task. Default is true. Set this to false while binding a data source with the gantt when the dependencies in the bound data source are known to be valid. This will greatly improve load time. See Reference for code example.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.EnforceDependencyConstraints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether newly added dependencies should be validated for appropriateness. For example, a task cannot have a dependency on it's parent/summary task. Default is true. Set this to false while binding a data source with the gantt when the dependencies in the bound data source are known to be valid. This will greatly improve load time. See Reference for code example.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.AutoCalculateSummaryTaskTimes
member.summary: Specifies whether the parent/summary task times will be calculated automatically based on the child tasks.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.AdjustDurationOnAssignment
member.summary: Reduces or increases the duration of the task when resources are assigned to or excluded from it.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.IDBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to int) from the source task item, indicating the id for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.SortOrderBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to int) from the source task item, indicating the sort order for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.
member.remarks:
When an activity is repositioned by the end user (or programatically) the order of the activity in the bound data source needs to be updated. This is possible only by including a field that indicates it's sort order.
If this is not set, any reordering information will not be persisted

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.NameBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string value from the source task item, indicating the name for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.IndentLevelBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to int) from the source task item, indicating the indent level for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.StartTimeBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to DateTime) from the source task item, indicating the start time for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.PreferredStartTimeBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to DateTime) from the source task item, indicating the preferred start time for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.
member.remarks: The StartTime of an activity refers to the current start time which could have been computed based on the dependencies and parent-child hierarchies that are in the gantt. But, this property refers to the preferred start time for this activity. So, the gantt will try to anchor the activity to this time whenever possible.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.EffortBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to TimeSpan) from the source task item, indicating the required effort for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.PredecessorIndicesBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string value from the source task item, indicating the predecessors for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ProgressPercentBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to double) from the source task item, indicating the progress info for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.DescriptionBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string value from the source task item, indicating the description for the activity (this value is currently not used in the implementation). Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ResourceItemsSource
member.summary: The data source list containing a list of objects representing the resources that can be assigned to each activity. Set this before setting the DataSource property. It's typical to set the AssignedResourcesBinding property as well, when you set this. The ResourceNameBinding property defines how the name of each resource can be retrieved from this data source (if this is a list of objects, instead of a list of strings).
member.remarks: Note that you can also add a list of strings for this property, in which case the ResourceNameBinding property need not be set.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ResourceNameBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) indicating the name for the resource. Setting this is optional. If you do not set this, the bound resource item's (if any) "toString" will be used as the resource name in the gantt.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ResourceIDBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) indicating the ID for the resource. This will be used to resolve the comma-separated resource assignments string in a task. Setting this is optional. If you do not set this, the ResourceNameBinding will be used to resolve the assignments string instead. If you do set this in XAML or before initializing the ResourceItemsSource with a source collection.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.ProjectGanttOptions.ResourceScheduleBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a WorkTimeSchedule instance from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) that defines the resource's schedule. Setting this is optional. If not set, the resource will inherit the same schedule as the overall project. Typically, you could bind this to a string property in your resource type and convert it into a WorkTimeSchedule as illustrated in the summary.
member.remarks:
The custom schedule can be represented as a string like this:
new ResourceInfo() { ResourceID = 2, ResourceName = "Resource 2", CustomScheduleString = "MON 8:00:00 16:00:00; TUE 8:00:00 16:00:00; WED 8:00:00 16:00:00; THU 8:00:00 16:00:00;" }
In which case this property would be set as:
ResourceNameBinding="{Binding ResourceName}" ResourceScheduleBinding="{Binding CustomScheduleString, Converter={StaticResource stringToWorkTimeScheduleConverter}}"

member.name: T:RadiantQMVC.RadiantQExtensions
member.summary: Provides HTMLHelpers for declaring Project and Flexy Gantt widgets in MVC (.aspx and .cshtml) pages.

member.name: M:RadiantQMVC.RadiantQExtensions.JQFlexyGantt(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.JQFlexyGanttSettings)
member.summary: Wrapper for the FlexyGantt jQuery widget. This is a light-weight, flexible and feature rich gantt component that display your hierarchical project or resource list in a multi-column tree list on the left and lets you visualize the assigned tasks and summary tasks over a time-scale on the right. This gantt has no built-in scheduling functionality.
member.remarks:
The FlexyGantt is built to let you bind to any kind of flat or hierarchical lists of project or resource data. Common with "resource views", you can optionally show multiple tasks in the same row in the gantt chart on the right.
Here are the options that needs to be set to configure the FlexyGantt.
Set the JSONDataSourceUrl from where JSON data representing the hierarchy of tasks will be retrieved. The HierarchyResolverFunction should then be specified to help resolve any hierarchy that needs to be displayed in the table.
If your leaf node has a list of tasks (as in a resource view), then set the TasksListProperty property to return a list of tasks from the leaf-nodes in the hierarchy defined above. (If the leaf nodes in the hierarchy are themselves tasks, then you do not have to set the TasksListProperty property.)
Set the TaskStartTime to specify how to retrieve the start time of a task from the bound data.
Set the TaskEndTime to specify how to retrieve the duration of a task from the bound data.
If you want to visualize the summary tasks then similarly set the ParentTaskStartTime and ParentTaskEndTimeProperty properties.
To visualize your project/resource list in a multi-column tree-list, in the FlatItemsSourceCreated handler include the jQuery code required to embed a FlexyTable widget. The FlexyTable should then be initialized with appropriate column templates to allow expand/collapse of hierarchical content. (If you do not set the CustomSourceListViewTemplate property, the left side of the gantt will be empty.)
Set the TaskItemTemplate to define the look and feel of the task bars.
Set the ParentTaskItemTemplate if you want to visualize the summary tasks as well.

member.name: M:RadiantQMVC.RadiantQExtensions.JQProjectGantt(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.Common.JQProjectGanttSettings)

This is a light-weight, flexible and feature rich gantt component that display your hierarchical project or resource list in a multi-column tree list on the left and lets you visualize the assigned tasks and summary tasks over a time-scale on the right.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttBaseWithOptions.UseChartVirtualization
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to use virtualization while rendering the chart. If Virtualization is on, only the visible rows are rendered in the chart allowing you to load a very large number of rows. However, scrolling could be slower than when virtualization is false. Default is false for backward compatibility. Turn this to true, if the gantt takes longer than 2 seconds to load your data, to improve load time. Set this before the gantt loads. For performance reasons, resetting after the load is not supported.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.SortOrderBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to int) from the source task item, indicating the sort order for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.
member.remarks:
When an activity is repositioned by the end user (or programatically) the order of the activity in the bound data source needs to be updated. This is possible only by including a field that indicates it's sort order.
If this is not set, any reordering information will not be persisted

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.NameBinding

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.StartTimeBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to DateTime) from the source task item, indicating the start time for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.PreferredStartTimeBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to DateTime) from the source task item, indicating the preferred start time for the activity. Setting this is optional for data bound instances of the gantt control.
member.remarks: The StartTime of an activity refers to the current start time which could have been computed based on the dependencies and parent-child hierarchies that are in the gantt. But, this property refers to the preferred start time for this activity. So, the gantt will try to anchor the activity to this time whenever possible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a value (convertible to TimeSpan) from the source task item, indicating the required effort for the activity. Setting this is mandatory for data bound instances of the gantt control.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.ResourceItemsSource
member.summary: The data source list containing a list of objects representing the resources that can be assigned to each activity. Set this before setting the DataSource property. It's typical to set the AssignedResourcesBinding property as well, when you set this. The ResourceNameBinding property defines how the name of each resource can be retrieved from this data source (if this is a list of objects, instead of a list of strings).
member.remarks: Note that you can also add a list of strings for this property, in which case the ResourceNameBinding property need not be set.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.ResourceNameBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) indicating the name for the resource. Setting this is optional. If you do not set this, the bound resource item's (if any) "toString" will be used as the resource name in the gantt.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.ResourceIDBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) indicating the ID for the resource. This will be used to resolve the comma-separated resource assignments string in a task. Setting this is optional. If you do not set this, the ResourceNameBinding will be used to resolve the assignments string instead. If you do set this in XAML or before initializing the ResourceItemsSource with a source collection.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.ResourceScheduleBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a WorkTimeSchedule instance from the source resource item (specified in the ResourceItemsSource list) that defines the resource's schedule. Setting this is optional. If not set, the resource will inherit the same schedule as the overall project. Typically, you could bind this to a string property in your resource type and convert it into a WorkTimeSchedule as illustrated in the summary.
member.remarks:
The custom schedule can be represented as a string like this:
new ResourceInfo() { ResourceID = 2, ResourceName = "Resource 2", CustomScheduleString = "MON 8:00:00 16:00:00; TUE 8:00:00 16:00:00; WED 8:00:00 16:00:00; THU 8:00:00 16:00:00;" }
In which case this property would be set as:
ResourceNameBinding="{Binding ResourceName}" ResourceScheduleBinding="{Binding CustomScheduleString, Converter={StaticResource stringToWorkTimeScheduleConverter}}"

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.GanttControl.AssignedResourcesBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding information that will return a string of resource names from the source task item, indicating the resources assigned to the corresponding activity. Setting this is optional.

member.name: T:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.FlexyGantt
member.summary: Wrapper for the jQuery FlexyGantt widget. This is a light-weight, flexible and intuitive gantt component that display your hierarchical project or resource list in a multi-column tree list on the left and lets you visualize the assigned tasks and summary tasks over a time-scale on the right. This gantt has no built-in scheduling functionality.
member.remarks:
The FlexyGantt is built to let you bind to any kind of flat or hierarchical lists of project or resource data. Common with "resource views", you can optionally show multiple tasks in the same row in the gantt chart on the right.
Here are the options that needs to be set to configure the FlexyGantt.
Set the JSONDataSourceUrl from where JSON data representing the hierarchy of tasks will be retrieved. The HierarchyResolverFunction should then be specified to help resolve any hierarchy that needs to be displayed in the table.
If your leaf node has a list of tasks (as in a resource view), then set the TasksListProperty property to return a list of tasks from the leaf-nodes in the hierarchy defined above. (If the leaf nodes in the hierarchy are themselves tasks, then you do not have to set the TasksListProperty property.)
Set the TaskStartTime to specify how to retrieve the start time of a task from the bound data.
Set the TaskEndTime to specify how to retrieve the duration of a task from the bound data.
If you want to visualize the summary tasks then similarly set the ParentTaskStartTime and ParentTaskEndTimeProperty properties.
To visualize your project/resource list in a multi-column tree-list, in the FlatItemsSourceCreated handler include the jQuery code required to embed a FlexyTable widget. The FlexyTable should then be initialized with appropriate column templates to allow expand/collapse of hierarchical content. (If you do not set the CustomSourceListViewTemplate property, the left side of the gantt will be empty.)
Set the TaskItemTemplate to define the look and feel of the task bars.
Set the ParentTaskItemTemplate if you want to visualize the summary tasks as well.

If your parent node itself represents a single task with properties representing the start and end times, then leave this at null and set the ParentTaskStartTimeBinding and ParentTaskEndTimeBinding properties.

member.summary: dynamicResolverFunction is same as hierarchy resolver function but it will call when the the flexyNodeData's ExpandState changed dynamically, and the value returned by resolverFunction will be ignored.

member.name: P:RadiantQ.WebForms.JQGantt.FlexyGantt.UseTimeRangeFilteredTasksInRows
member.summary: Normally all the tasks within a row are rendered in the UI even if they are out the current view. But, this would bog things down if there are thounds of tasks to show in the view. Set this to true if you want them to be filtered every time the chart's view span changes. Use this in conjunction with UseTimeRangeFilteredTasksInRows, TimeRangeFilteredTasksTimeBuffer and FilterTasksByTimeRange event.

member.name: M:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.LocalizedStrings.GetLocalizedString(System.String)
member.summary: Get the localized string value specifying the "string name". This will also return any overriden string specified via the OverrideLocalizedString method.
member.param: The name of a string resource declared in the resx of this RadiantQ.GanttControls.dll. The best way to find the list of string resource names is to open the dll in a tool like Reflector.
member.returns: The localized string value based on the specified string name.

member.name: M:RadiantQ.Web.JQGantt.LocalizedStrings.OverrideLocalizedString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sometimes you might not like the default strings that are being used. In such cases, call this method to override the default values with custom ones.
member.param: The name of a string resource declared in the resx of this RadiantQ.GanttControls.dll. The best way to find the list of string resource names is to open the dll in a tool like Reflector.
The value to override. Specifying a "null" will clear the override for the specified string-name.
